intro: Conyza flexilis, commonly known as the flexible horseweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with opposite, hairy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Conyza flexilis is known for its wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its widespread distribution.
